text: Colobodactylus taunayi, also known commonly as the Taunay teiid or Taunay's teiid, is a species of lizard in the family Gymnophthalmidae. The species is endemic to Brazil. ==Etymology== The specific name, taunayi, is in honor of Brazilian historian Afonso d'Escragnolle Taunay.Beolens, Bo; Watkins, Michael; Grayson, Michael (2011). The Eponym Dictionary of Reptiles. Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press. xiii + 296 pp. . (Colobodactylus taunayi, p. 261). ==Geographic range== C. taunayi occurs in the Brazilian state of São Paulo. ==Habitat== The preferred natural habitat of C. taunayi is forest. ==Reproduction== C. taunayi is oviparous. ==References== ==Further reading== *Amaral A (1933). "Estudos sobre Lacertilios neotropicos. I. Novos generos e especies de lagartos do Brasil ". Memorias do Instituto Butantan 7: 51–75. (Colobodactylus taunayi, new species, pp. 70–71). (in Portuguese). Category:Colobodactylus Category:Reptiles of Brazil Category:Endemic fauna of Brazil Category:Reptiles described in 1933 Category:Taxa named by Afrânio Pompílio Gastos do Amaral
title: Colobodactylus taunayi
